result.execSummary:
The defendant Shavon N Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is being requested in the amount of $300.00 to which the defendant will not stipulate.  Hearing is set for 12-21-2015 at 8:15.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: Serve 20 days in the House of Correction, each count consecutive  STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Shavon N Martin not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has not received additional documentation for restitution.  Court sets restitution at $0.

Defendant Shavon N Martin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS to counts 2 and 3:  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 days time served. 
Count 3:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2.
The court STAYED sentences and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 16 months concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction, each count consecutive  STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Restitution is being requested in the amount of $300.00 to which the defendant will not stipulate.  Hearing is set for 12-21-2015 at 8:15.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shavon N Martin in court with Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 2 and Count 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

State requests adjournment for sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Shavon N Martin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Shavon N Martin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
